text: John Quentin McCord (June 26, 1978 â€“ August 13, 2020) was an American professional football player. He was a wide receiver in the National Football League (NFL) and Canadian Football League (CFL). He was drafted in the seventh round of the 2001 NFL Draft by the Atlanta Falcons. He played college football at Kentucky. In his career, McCord also played with the Oakland Raiders, Winnipeg Blue Bombers, Edmonton Eskimos. He finished his career playing arena football with the Kentucky Horsemen. He was born in LaGrange, Georgia. McCord died on August 13, 2020 at the age of 42.Former UK Football Star Quentin McCord Dead at 42 ==References== Category:1978 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American football wide receivers Category:Atlanta Falcons players Category:Edmonton Elks players Category:Sportspeople from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Winnipeg Blue Bombers players
title: Quentin McCord
